Papers of the Page and Walker Families
1742-1886

University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the Page and Walker Families, Accession #3098, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was deposited by Miss Anne Page of Newport News, Virginia, on 1949 February 10. It was purchased by the library on 1975 May 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers of Thomas Walker, his son Francis, and other family members contain accounts, receipts, slave bills of sale, legal papers & correspondence regarding debts & estate settlement comprise the bulk of the collection. There are a variety of plats and surveys, land patents and indentures for Louisa and Albemarle Co., Va. property, including a survey of the Castle Hill estate, 1816 and Keswick, 1865. Many items pertain either to the Loyal Land Co. (1750s) or to the Albemarle Iron Works.
Of special interest are copies of treaties, 1744 and 1752, with the Six Nations at Lancaster and Logstown, and a sale of 6 million acres in Ohio in 1777 to George Croghan transferred to Walker.

Correspondents and legal parties include Nicholas Cabell, William H. Cabell, W. O. Callis, Edward Carter, George Croghan, Robert Dinwiddie, Francis Fauquier, John Murray, 4th earl of Dunmore, Charles Everett, Joshua Fry, Ira Garrett, George Gilmer, Peachey Ridgway Gilmer, Sir William Gooch, Thomas Jefferson, Andrew Lewis, Fielding Lewis, Benjamin Lincoln, Reuben Lindsay, Peter Lyons, Matthew Maury, Nicholas Meriwether, James Monroe, Mann Page, R.C.M. Page, Louis Philippe Albert d'Orleans, comte de Paris, D. M. Randolph, Judith Page Walker Rives, Alexander Spotswood, Francis Walker, William Wirt, and James Wood.
